article_title: Lloyds and HSBC Still Face Tax Headache in Tory Britain
article_text:
U.K. stocks have escaped the interventionists, but its banks now must face down the isolationists.

A Conservative U.K. governmentends the threat of the Labour Party clamping down on banks or energy suppliers and means positive policies for asset gatherers and home builders. These stocks jumped Friday.

But for banks, the promised referendum on the U.K.’s future in Europe should temper investor optimism. Equally tricky is the...

twitter.description: Heavy-handed restrictions on market share are unlikely under a Conservative government. But the U.K.’s place in Europe and the bank levy remain thorny issues for lenders.
twitter.creator: @PaulJDavies

image.alt: Lloyds and HSBC face tax headache in Tory Britain -- Heard on the Street
